tn.text: Jeremiah has just told the people of Judah what will happen to the land.
At the time when the events in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:31|7:32]] [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:33|to 34]] happen.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
This word "they" here refers to the people who will destroy Jerusalem.
"the princes of Judah"
The word "them" refers to the bones of the people of Judah.

tn.ref: these things in the sky that they have followed and served
tn.text: "these things in the sky that they loved and which they served." The word "they" here refers to the people of Judah.
AT: "and that they have faithfully obeyed." See how you translated "walked after" in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:02:23|2:23]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"and that they have inquired of"

tn.ref: The bones will not be gathered or buried
tn.text: AT: "No one will gather their bones and bury them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh is showing how unpleasant they will be. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"like manure" or "like poop"

tn.ref: on the surface of the earth
tn.text: "all over the ground"
The word "them" refers to the people of Judah.

tn.ref: they will choose death instead of life for themselves, all who are still left over from this evil nation
tn.text: "those who are still left from this evil family will want to die instead of stay alive"
Yahweh is speaking to Jeremiah.
"to the people of Judah"

tn.ref: Does anyone fall and not get up?
tn.text: AT: "You know that when someone falls, he gets back up." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]]).

tn.ref: Does anyone get lost and not try to return?
tn.text: AT: "When someone is lost, he tries to return to the right path."

tn.ref: Why has this people, Jerusalem, turned away in permanent faithlessness?
tn.text: Yahweh uses this question to emphasize that the way that the people of Judah are acting does not make sense. AT: "It does not make sense that this people of Jerusalem have turned away in permanent faithlessness."
The word "Jerusalem" refers to the people of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"continue to worship false gods" or "cling to lies"
Yahweh is speaking about the people of Judah.
"did not say what is right"
"because of his wickedness"
AT: "I have done a terrible thing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: All of them go where they wish
tn.text: "The entire people continues to run." Yahweh compares their eagerness to do evil with running. AT: "All of the people continues to eagerly do the same evil." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: like a stallion rushing toward battle
tn.text: The people are extremely eager to do evil like a stallion that runs toward a battle because he is very eager to get to the battle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
The word "stallion" refers to a male horse.

tn.ref: Even the stork in heaven knows the right times; and the doves, swifts, and cranes
tn.text: "the birds know when they should leave the cold country for the warm country.
All of these are different types of birds which fly to a warm place before their other place gets too cold.
"go from a cold country to a warm country"
These are Yahweh's words about the people of Judah.

tn.ref: How can you say, "We are wise, for the law of Yahweh is with us"?
tn.text: "Why do you say, we are wise! And we have the law of Yahweh?" AT: "You should not say that you are wise and that you have the law of Yahweh." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The "you" here refers to the people of Judah.

tn.ref: The deceitful pen of the scribes has created deceit
tn.text: The pen represents the words that the scribes write. AT: "The false things that the scribes have been writing have given you false ideas about the law of Yahweh." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The wise men will be ashamed
tn.text: "These men who think they are wise will feel ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
"Enemies will defeat them and take them away"

tn.ref: so what use is their wisdom?
tn.text: AT: "so their so called wisdom does not do them any good."
"the people who will take control of their land"

tn.ref: for from the youngest ... all of them practice deceit
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:06:13|6:13]].
These are Yahweh's words about the people of Judah.

tn.ref: For they treated the fracture of the daughter of my people ... says Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:06:13|6:14-15]].
"the leaf will dry up"

tn.ref: and what I have given to them will pass away
tn.text: The meaning of the hebrew is uncertain. Possible meanings are 1) "I gave instructions to my people, but my people disobeyed the instructions" or 2) "therefore, I have given these people over to their enemies, so their enemies can trample over them."
Yahweh continues his message by telling us what the people of Judah will say at the time of their punishment.
AT: "We should not stay here." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Come together; let us go to the fortified cities
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:04:04|4:5]].
"the cities with high walls and soldiers to defend it"

tn.ref: and we will become silent there in death
tn.text: AT: "and we will die there." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: For Yahweh our God will silence us
tn.text: AT: "because Yahweh our God will put us to death."

tn.ref: He will make us drink poison
tn.text: "He will make us drink poison" refers to God's judgment. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"but understand, there will be"

tn.ref: but there will be nothing good
tn.text: "but nothing good will happen"
Yahweh continues his message about the punishment coming to Judah.

tn.ref: The snorting of his stallions is heard from Dan
tn.text: AT: "People in Dan hear the sound of the enemy army coming to attack Judah." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
male horses
AT: "The people of the land shake with fear" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: at the sound of the neighing of his strong horses
tn.text: "when they hear the sound of the enemy's strong horses"
the sound that a horse makes
The word "they" refers to the invading army.
"and destroy the land." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I am sending out snakes among you
tn.text: The snakes represent the enemy soldiers. AT: "I am sending out enemy soldiers to fight you." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
AT: "vipers that you cannot send away with magic."
a kind of snake that is poisonous and has large fangs
AT: "They will attack you" or "They will destroy you."
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
Jeremiah and Yahweh have a conversation about the people of Judah.

tn.ref: My sorrow has no end, and my heart is sick
tn.text: This difficult passage in Hebrew is interpreted in different ways by modern versions.
The word "my" refers to Jeremiah. AT: "I am very sad." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
The word "my" refers to Jeremiah. AT: "I feel sick deep down inside me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: See! The screaming voice of the daughter of my people from a far distant land!
tn.text: Jeremiah is speaking about the people of Judah. Possible meanings are 1) "The people of Judah call out from exile in a far-away land" or 2) "The people of Judah call out from all over the land of Israel."
Israel as a daughter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Jerusalem is referred to as Zion. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Is not Yahweh in Zion? Or is not her king in her?
tn.text: Jeremiah tells what the people of Judah are saying. The two parallel questions show that the people of Judah are wondering why Yahweh is not saving them. AT: "Why does Yahweh not save us if he is the king in Jerusalem?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Why then would they offend me with their carved figures
tn.text: The word "me" refers to Yahweh. AT: "If they want me to save them, then they must not offend me by worshiping their idols." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
Jeremiah continues talking about the people of Judah.
"Harvest time is over"

tn.ref: But we have not been saved
tn.text: Jeremiah tells what the people of Judah are saying. The word "we" refers to the people of Judah. AT: "But Yahweh has not saved us." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I am hurt because of the hurt of the daughter of my people
tn.text: The word "I" refers to Jeremiah. AT: "I feel very upset because the people of Judah are experiencing horrible things." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Is there no medicine in Gilead? Is there no healer there?
tn.text: AT: "There is medicine in Gilead! There are doctors in Gilead!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Why will the healing of the daughter of my people not happen
tn.text: AT: "But my people have spiritual wounds that medicine and doctors cannot heal." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
